results.title: Nuclear addiction: Dr. Rosalie Bertell on the Cost of Det...
results.creator_credit: Terre Nash, Bonnie Sherr Klein, Kathleen Shannon, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film records a lecture by scientist, Roman Catholic nun and world-renowned expert on low-level radiation, Dr. Rosalie Bertell. She explains the complex chain reactions that follow nuclear explosions, affecting natural life systems, our climate and human health, and briefly describes other war and defense operations that contribute to the level of nuclear pollution. Together, these sources have radically altered our planetary environment, endangering the future of life on Earth. Powerful stock footage and stills add urgency to Dr. Bertell’s quiet plea. The film ends with her lucid ideas on what steps must be taken to reverse this critical situation.

results.title: Nubie 64
results.brief_description: This documentary produced by the ‘Institut Geographique National’ describes the UNESCO’s programme to save the temple complex of Abu Simbel under the threat of total submersion by the damming of the Nile river at Assouan.
results.description: This documentary produced by the ‘Institut Geographique National’ describes the UNESCO’s programme to save the temple complex of Abu Simbel under the threat of total submersion by the damming of the Nile river at Assouan.

results.title: Nowhere in Africa = Nirgendwo in Afrika
results.creator_credit: Caroline Link, Peter Herrmann, MC One Productions, Bavaria Film and Constantin Film
results.brief_description: As the title suggests, a Jewish family migrate from WWII Germany to Kenya in Africa and find themselves displaced persons and “Nowhere in Africa”. The father Walter, previously a lawyer in Germany, goes on ahead to establish himself and then sends for his socialite wife Jettel and young daughter Regina to come as soon as possible. Struggling with temporary internment by the British and being sacked as farm manager, the family are soon re-established on a new farm and try to cope with being land mangers. The family are bound together, and to the place they now live, through their African cook, Owuor (Sidede Onyulo), who has a special bond with Regina. Letters from home confirm their worst fears as the family members they left behind are sent to live in ghettos and to ‘work camps’. After the war, the family, now established in Africa, struggle with the idea of returning to Germany. A heartfelt and personal family drama located in an imposing landscape and set to a moving musical score. Nominated for an Academy Award in 2002 for Best Foreign Language Film and winner of five German Film Awards. Based on an autobiographical novel by Stefanie Sweig. Cast includes: Juliane Kohler, Merab Ninidze, Matthias Habich, Lea Kurka, Karoline Eckertz.

results.title: Nowhere game
results.creator_credit: Martyn Goddard, John Hughes, Buoyancy Foundation and Magic Dragon Productions
results.brief_description: ‘Cinema verite’ account of illicit drug use in Melbourne’s inner city; a critical response to the dominant media sensationalism of the 70’s. Looks at the social and legal proglems of young drug addicts and discusses their emotional dependence on drugs, feelings of exclusion from society, and the unsuitability of the criminal process being applied to drug offenders.

results.title: Nowhere Boys
results.brief_description: Four teenage boys get lost in the forest and discover, when they return home, that they are in an alternate world identical to theirs except for one startling difference - they were never born.

results.title: Now you see me, now you don't: survival mechanisms of insects
results.creator_credit: Muriel Jackson, Hiroyuki Wakamatsu, Stuart Beecroft, Tadashi Ono, Wally Longul, NHK Entapuraizu and TV Ontario
results.brief_description: A fascinating insight into the creative and sometimes bizarre survival mechanisms of insects. The discussion centres on the daily dramas unfolding beneath the canopies of a tropical rainforest in Central Malaysia, where insects such as butterflies, grasshoppers and caterpillars must rely on disguise, camouflage and mimicry to maximise their chances of survival. This presents the viewer with a glimpse of the complex relationships existing between ecosystems, and the potential impact deforestation could have on insect populations. Includes video support notes.

results.title: Now you see me, now you don't
results.creator_credit: Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: About the defence techniques of insects, including camouflage, mimicry, stinging spines, offensive chemicals, the ants “protection racket”, warning colors and behaviour, and portable shelters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Now you see it!
results.brief_description: Magician extraordinaire, Paul Daniels, takes us into his world of magic and demonstrates just how simple some tricks can be. Paul first introduces some magic history about past magicians and illusionists including Hercat, Chung Ling Soo, and the Great Lyle and then with a group of friends, proceeds to perform twenty simple tricks which can be done in your own home using everyday props such as cards, matches, dice, jars etc. Finally, Paul demonstrates and explains in detail how each trick is done offering advice along the way.

results.title: Now you're talking
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian Cinema Series”.
The 30s saw the introduction of the “talkies” and a new era of filmmaking began. This was to decline with World War II. Excerpts from many of the films made during this decade are seen in this video. Please note that the commentary by Leo McKern has been recorded on another channel and may not be heard over the original sound recording. Includes b&w sequences.

results.title: Now voyager
results.creator_credit: Irving Rapper, Hal B Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Bette Davis delivered a superlative performance as a neurotic spinster fighting to free herself from the shackles of a tyrannical mother. Pushed into a nervous breakdown, the dowdy Davis is cured by a psychiatrist (Claude Rains) and emerges as a poised and beautiful woman - only to be trapped in a doomed romance with a married man. Also stars Paul Henreid. Based on the novel by Olive Higgins Pronty.
